etymologies: late 18th century (as a verb, originally dialect): variant of dialect swithen ‘to burn’

definitions: an area of land cleared for cultivation by slashing and burning vegetation

examples.text: paddy rice and rice grown in swiddens in hilly areas provides subsistence for the majority of the population
the forest had been reduced to swidden

shortDefinitions: area of land cleared for cultivation by slashing and burning vegetation

definitions: the method of clearing land by slashing and burning vegetation
shortDefinitions: method of clearing land by slashing and burning vegetation
